commText: Welcome back.. The super-soppers were doing the rounds during the break. Kohli said there was no dew yet and RCB will hope it stays that way. They have activated their impact sub - Saurav Chauhan goes out and Himanshu Sharma comes in. Topley to start proceedings. He has a slip in place. We are ready to go..
Most individual hundreds for a team in Men’s T20 cricket 18 - RCB 17 - India 14 - PBKS 14 - RR 13 - Somerset

Virat Kohli: The wicket looks quite different from the outside. It feels like it's flat, but the ball is holding up in the pitch, that's when you realise the pace changes. One of us (Virat or Faf) had to bat till the end. I feel this total is effective on this pitch. I am not coming in with any premeditation. I knew I couldn't get over aggressive, just that I had to keep the bowlers guessing. It's just experience and maturity of playing the conditions. Even if there's dew, the surface is rough and dry, won't be easy for the batters. I couldn't get under the ball against Ashwin. Couldn't slog towards mid-wicket, so had to target straight down the ground.
Most hundreds in Men’s T20 cricket 22 - Chris Gayle 11 - Babar Azam 9 - Virat Kohli 8 - Aaron Finch 8 - Michael Klinger 8 - David Warner
Most hundreds in the IPL 8 - Virat Kohli 6 - Chris Gayle 5 - Jos Buttler 4 - KL Rahul 4 - David Warner 4 - Shane Watson
Kohli’s innings today \nvs Pace: 67 (39), SR: 171.79, 4s/6s: 11/1 \nvs Spin: 46(33), SR: 139.39, 4s/6s: 1/3

Slowest IPL hundreds (by balls taken) 67 - Manish Pandey (RCB) vs Deccan Chargers, Centurion, 2009 67 - Virat Kohli (RCB) vs RR, Jaipur, 2024 66 - Sachin Tendulkar (MI) vs KTK, Mumbai WS, 2011 66 - David Warner (DC) vs KKR, Delhi, 2010 66 - Jos Buttler (RR) vs MI, Mumbai DYP, 2022

21:10 Local Time, 15:40 GMT: Royal Challengers Bengaluru do manage to cross the 180-mark. But is it enough? Totals similar to this have been defended a couple of times this season but it was from Rajasthan Royals. Do RCB have the attack to do it? That only time will tell. This first essay was all about Virat Kohli. He didn't have a great record at the venue or against RR and then there was the match-up with Boult, but Kohli has just gone about his business like only he can. He started slowly but paced his innings perfectly and reached his hundred in the 19th over. Faf played the perfect second fiddle in the 100+ opening stand and the platform was set, but the only disappointing thing was the likes of Maxwell and Green could not capitalize. That might be something which hurts RCB later on. For now we await RR's reply. Back soon..

Avesh Khan to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli finishes with a boundary. There was a deep backward point and deep extra cover. Kohli walks down, has to reach for the low full toss outside off and slices it over the cover-point region. He equals his highest IPL score and carries his bat through. Chahal walks up and shakes his hand as he walks off to a standing ovation from his team mates

Avesh Khan to Green, 1 run, Avesh is bowling to his field. The off-side is set for the wide yorker and though this was a full toss outside off, Green drills it straight to deep extra cover, just a single
Avesh Khan to Kohli, 1 run, slower ball outside off, Kohli drives towards long-off and has to be content with a single

Avesh Khan to Kohli, FOUR, that's smart. Kohli knows Avesh is trying the yorker outside off and has the field set for that, so he walks across, takes it on the full and whips it wide of deep mid-wicket
Avesh Khan to Kohli, no run, excellent riposte from Avesh. Spears it in the blockhole outside off, Kohli tries to squeeze it out but does not lay bat on ball

Avesh Khan to Kohli, FOUR, that's the start Kohli and RCB needed. He walks down, converts it into a full toss and lofts it straight down the ground, one bounce and over the ropes. Can they get past 180?
Avesh Khan [3.0-0-32-0] is back into the attack
RCB need a good final over. That 19th over from Burger has stemmed the momentum. Avesh to bowl..

Nandre Burger to Green, no run, what an over! Just 4 runs from the over. Burger goes short and into the wicket, Green is early into the pull and fails to connect once again. Excellent last couple of overs from Burger, he went for 26 in his first two but still finishes with 4-0-33-1
Nandre Burger to Green, no run, bouncer with nice height, Green attempts the hook and does not connect. One for the over signals the umpire

Nandre Burger to Kohli, 1 run, hundred for Kohli. Not his favourite batting venue in the IPL? The King answers that question in style. He raises his bat and acknowledges the applause all around. This has been a fine knock. He has barely put a foot wrong and looked in control right through. Coming to the ball: Low full toss and Kohli lofts it back down the ground, straight to long-off and hence only a single
Nandre Burger to Kohli, wide, tries to keep it away from Kohli's range and sprays it outside off, Kohli leaves and picks up the wide
Nandre Burger to Green, 1 run, short and bowled into the wicket, Green pulls it on the bounce to deep mid-wicket. Just 2 runs off the first 3 balls
Nandre Burger to Kohli, 1 run, angled in from round the wicket, Kohli flicks it towards long-on and settles with a single

Nandre Burger to Kohli, no run, direct hit and Green wasn't in the frame. Full toss and Kohli drills it straight to extra cover, Green was off for the single but Kohli wasn't keen, Dubey has a shy at the bowler's end and does not hit the target
Nandre Burger [3.0-0-29-1] is back into the attack

Two overs left. Burger, Boult and Avesh all have overs left. Samson and Burger having a chat, Buttler joins in. It will be Burger to bowl this one.. Rajasthan Royals have used their impact sub - Chahal goes out and Shubham Dubey comes in..

Chahal to Green, 2 runs, floated up outside off and the ball turns away, Green swings across the line and toe-ends it fine, Burger chases from short third and keeps it to a couple. Kohli and Green share a smile at the other end
Chahal to Kohli, 1 run, throws it even wider and Kohli slaps the drive to deep extra cover, just a single

Chahal to Kohli, SIX, Kohli has a big smile on his face. So does Chahal. They know that his former skipper won that battle. Flighted outside off, Kohli fetches the slog sweep and hits it flat over cow corner. He rarely plays this shot and hence the smiles
Chahal to Green, 1 run, quicker and at the pads, Green flicks to wide long-on
Cameron Green, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Chahal to Saurav Chauhan, out Caught by Jaiswal!! Second wicket for Chahal. Brave move from Samson to bowl him the 18th and Chahal hasn't disappointed. Saurav would feel slightly disappointed. This was short and outside off, he shuffles and slaps it straight to extra cover, Jaiswal needed a couple of attempts to hang on. Saurav Chauhan c Jaiswal b Chahal 9(6) [6s-1]
Chahal to Saurav Chauhan, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Deep backward point in place. Chahal stays over the wicket
Chahal to Kohli, 1 run, flighted on leg-stump, Kohli happy to nudge it to deep mid-wicket
Yuzvendra Chahal [3.0-0-23-1] is back into the attack

Ashwin to Saurav Chauhan, SIX, that's a good end to the over. Ashwin had kept it tight till that point but this was fraction short and Saurav was quick to pounce, he rocks back and nails the pull over cow corner
Ashwin to Saurav Chauhan, no run, spots Saurav back away and pushes it outside off, Saurav attempts the drive and is beaten on the outside edge
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, now the off-break bowled short and into the wicket, Kohli stays leg-side and slaps it straight to deep extra cover
Ashwin to Kohli, no run, another carrom ball that drifts on the pads, Kohli misses the flick and is struck on the pad
Ashwin to Kohli, 2 runs, flatter carrom ball on leg, Kohli whips it between deep mid-wicket and long-on, easy brace
Ashwin to Saurav Chauhan, 1 run, flighted outside off, Saurav chops the cut off the under-edge past Samson, just a single
Ravichandran Ashwin [3.0-0-18-0] is back into the attack
Avesh Khan to Kohli, no run, slower ball outside off, Kohli wanted to steer it fine and is beaten on the outside edge. He's livid with himself

Avesh Khan to Kohli, FOUR, poor bowling and execution. Avesh goes short and into the wicket, but the line is outside off and Kohli has the pre-offered width, he slaps it over extra cover and picks up the third boundary for the over

Avesh Khan to Kohli, 2 runs, I0$ back of a length delivery, Kohli turns it to the right of Avesh and calls for two, the ball barely reaches mid-on and Saurav is back for the second, puts in the dive and makes his ground

Most partnership runs for the first wicket in the IPL 2220 - David Warner & Shikhar Dhawan 1478 - Gautam Gambhir & Robin Uthappa 1461 - Shikhar Dhawan & Prithvi Shaw 1432 - Virat Kohli & Faf du Plessis 1401 - David Warner & Jonny Bairstow

Slight hold up in play. Not sure why though. Looks like some issue with Avesh's studs, he has removed his shoe and is taking care of it. Meanwhile, Saurav Chauhan was handed his maiden IPL cap by Dinesh Karthik. Ready to resume..

Avesh Khan to Kohli, FOUR, this is just class! Not much wrong with the delivery - Avesh goes for the yorker outside off, Kohli bends down, opens the bat face and squeezes it to the right of short third. Ashwin the fielder there and he is not the most agile to make the stop
Avesh Khan to Kohli, FOUR, I0$ slower ball but with width on offer, Kohli throws his bat and slices it wide of short third
Avesh Khan to Saurav Chauhan, 1 run, short and at the body, Chauhan pulls and picks out deep backward square
Avesh Khan [2.0-0-17-0] is back into the attack
Nandre Burger to Saurav Chauhan, 1 run, fullish delivery around off, Chauhan brings his bat down in time and squirts an inside edge backward of square
Saurav Chauhan, left handed bat, comes to the crease

100-plus opening stands in RR vs RCB IPL matches 181* - Virat Kohli & Devdutt Padikkal (RCB), Mumbai WS, 2021 125 - Virat Kohli & Faf du Plessis (RCB), Jaipur, 2024 109 - Graeme Smith & Swapnil Asnodkar (RR), Jaipur, 2008

Nandre Burger to Maxwell, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Maxwell's woes with the bat continues.. The stage was set for him to explode but it is him who explodes. A pacy back of a length ball angling in, Maxwell makes room to cut and misses, the ball thuds into the stumps. Yet another failure for Maxi. Maxwell b Nandre Burger 1(3)
Nandre Burger to Maxwell, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!
Nandre Burger to Maxwell, no run, short and angled in, Maxwell swings across the line and fails to connect
Faf du Plessis vs Yuzvendra Chahal in the IPL Runs: 44 Balls: 50 Dismissals: 3 Avg: 14.66 SR: 88 4s/6s: 1/0 Dots: 13
Nandre Burger to Kohli, 1 run, short of length delivery bowled into the wicket, Kohli is early into the pull and toe-ends it onto his body, the ball rolls to short third
Nandre Burger to Maxwell, 1 run, 146.5ks very full delivery outside off, Maxwell jams the drive in front of mid-off
FYI, Burger is bowling from round the wicket

Nandre Burger to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, direct hit and Maxwell was gone. Kohli charges down and is cramped for room, the ball hits the thigh pad and drops next to the pitch, Burger runs forward and kicks the ball, he's not on target and Maxwell survives a diamond duck
Nandre Burger [2.0-0-26-0] is back into the attack
Glenn Maxwell, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Some confusion regarding the bowling change. Ashwin had handed his cap over but takes it back. Maxwell had come out with a cap, but the substitute runs out with a helmet for both batters. Burger comes on and Buttler has a word with him
STAT: Kohli and du Plessis added more runs today (as a pair) than they collectively managed across the last four innings (124).
STAT: This is the 47th century partnership for RCB in the IPL, well clear of the next best (38 by CSK). 15 of them have come for the opening wicket, which is bettered only by CSK (16).

Chahal to du Plessis, out Caught by Buttler!! Buttler makes no mistake. Chahal breaks the parntership. Faf had decided to go after the bowling no matter what. He drags the flighted delivery from outside off and swipes it towards long-on, Buttler moves to his left and takes a good catch. Not a fluent knock but he has laid the platform for the others. du Plessis c Buttler b Chahal 44(33) [4s-2 6s-2]
Chahal to du Plessis, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Chahal to du Plessis, 2 runs, dropped! Boult has put down a sitter. This was a typical Chahal move - loops it outside off and makes Faf reach for the loft, he miscues it horribly and Boult settles under it near deep extra cover, he goes reverse cup and the ball burst through his hands. Chahal is not a happy bowler
Chahal to Kohli, 1 run, floated up outside off and Kohli drags the slog sweep off the inner half to deep mid-wicket
Cover moves to cover-point and sweeper moves to deep extra cover
Chahal to Kohli, no run, slower and spinning away, Kohli attempts the big slog sweep and does not connect. Smartly bowled

Chahal to Kohli, FOUR, good effort but Parag can't prevent the boundary. Tossed up around off, Kohli smashes it straight down the ground and Parag gets around from long-off, dives and gets a hand, but the ball escapes his grasp and rolls into the ad cushions

Chahal to Kohli, 2 runs, dropped! Tough chance and would have been a stunner had Burger held on. Short and turning away, Kohli cuts and does not keep it down, the ball flies towards backward point and Burger dives to his right, with an outstretched hand but cannot hang on. Those need to stick
Chahal to Kohli, wide, flighted outside off and that is a bait from Chahal, Kohli does not fall for it and the umpire signals a wide
Yuzvendra Chahal [2.0-0-13-0] is back into the attack

Batters involved in most 100-plus partnerships in the IPL (any wicket) 28 - Virat Kohli 26 - David Warner 21 - Shikhar Dhawan 20 - Chris Gayle 20 - Faf du Plessis 17 - AB de Villiers Kohli is involved in 11 100-plus opening partnerships in the IPL, which is matched by Chris Gayle and bettered only by David Warner (14).

Highlights (7-13 overs) - Ashwin and Chahal put the squeeze after the powerplay - Faf breaks the shackles by smashing a couple of sixes off Boult - After 3 dots Kohli launches Chahal over the rope - Fifty no. 3 of the season for Kohli, comes off 39 balls - Parag drops a tough return catch, Faf survives - Faf and Kohli bring up the 100-run stand in 11.2 overs - Run-out chance missed as Avesh fails to score a direct hit, second reprieve for Faf

Strategic timeout! The RCB openers have set the platform and they'll be looking forward to maximise the remaining 7 overs. With plenty of big hitters waiting in the dugout the Challengers are set to post a challenging total.

Most 100-plus opening partnerships in the IPL 6 - David Warner & Shikhar Dhawan 5 - David Warner & Jonny Bairstow 5 - Virat Kohli & Faf du Plessis 4 - Mayank Agarwal & KL Rahul 4 - Ruturaj Gaikwad & Devon Conway 4 - Virat Kohli & Chris Gayle
Most 100-plus partnerships in the IPL (any wicket) 10 - Virat Kohli & AB de Villiers 9 - Virat Kohli & Chris Gayle 6 - David Warner & Shikhar Dhawan 6 - Virat Kohli & Faf du Plessis
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, tad short on middle and leg, Kohli nudges it through the leg-side for a single to end the over
Ashwin to Kohli, 2 runs, fraction short as Kohli punches it down the ground where Parag stops it, parrying it to the fielder charging across from long-off
Ashwin to du Plessis, 1 run, drags this through the on-side for a single does du Plessis
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, punched to wide long-off by Kohli for a single

Ashwin to Kohli, 2 runs, flicked towards wide long-on by Kohli as the fielder tries to stop it with a dive. Guess it was Jurel who got his hands to it, but wasn't in control. Parag converges from long-on and does extremely well to grab it inches before the boundary
Ashwin to du Plessis, 1 run, slightly fuller on middle and leg, du Plessis drives it along the turf to long-on for one
Ravichandran Ashwin [2.0-0-10-0] is back into the attack
Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, pitched up by the pacer as du Plessis drills it to long-off for a single
Avesh Khan to Kohli, 1 run, full and quick on off, Kohli drives it through cover for a single
Avesh Khan to Kohli, FOUR, deft touch! A slower short ball by Avesh Khan, Kohli plays it late and guides it over short third man. In the zone now, middling everything against the pacers

Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, run-out chance missed! du Plessis riding his luck today. This was a yorker length ball and du Plessis squeezes it towards the bowler and sets off for a run. Avesh gathers it quickly and goes for a direct-hit at his end, but fails to nail it
Avesh Khan to Kohli, 1 run, 100-run stand up between the RCB openers! This was pitched up by the bowler, full and quick as Kohli drives it to long-off for a single
Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, short of a length around off, du Plessis slaps it to long-off on a few bounces
Avesh Khan [1.0-0-8-0] is back into the attack
STAT: Kohli's first 50-plus score in nine IPL innings in Jaipur. He aggregated 149 runs at 21.28 (SR: 94.3) in eight previous innings here.

Riyan Parag to du Plessis, 1 run, dropped! A short ball by Riyan Parag and du Plessis slaps it back to the bowler powerfully. Tough chance as Parag gets his hands to it, can't latch on to it though as they end the over with a side. A slightly expensive over by the spinner
Riyan Parag to Kohli, 1 run, punched down the ground to long-off for a single

Riyan Parag to Kohli, SIX, Kohli brings up his fifty, third of the season! Gets there with a maximum. Stands tall and launches it over long-on with a clean swing of his blade. That Orange Cap suits him more than anyone else..
Riyan Parag to du Plessis, 1 run, darted on middle and leg, du Plessis swings across, gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
Riyan Parag to du Plessis, no run, a slingy action, much like Kedar Jadhav. du Plessis makes room and reaches out for it with a drive, straight to cover though
Riyan Parag to Kohli, 1 run, tad short on off, Kohli punches it through the off-side for a single
Riyan Parag, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack

Chahal to du Plessis, 2 runs, punched to cover where the fielder gets his hands to it, parrying it away to the man charging in from the deep. First productive over against a spinner. RCB - 88/0 at the halfway stage..
Chahal to Kohli, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Kohli slaps it through the off-side for a single
Chahal to Kohli, SIX, just clears the fielder in the deep. A tossed up delivery by Chahal and Kohli whips it uppishly over wide long-on where the fielder was a mere spectator
Chahal to Kohli, no run, gets an inside edge on to the pads as this one keeps straight
Chahal to Kohli, no run, floated outside off, Kohli gets beaten on the cut
Chahal to Kohli, no run, fired outside off, but just inside the tramline

Boult to du Plessis, 1 run, slapped past the bowler by du Plessis for a couple, good work by the fielder in the deep who collects it in on the go and gets rid of the ball quickly. 16 runs from the over.. It is one-short as one of the batters has failed to plonk the bat over the line
Boult to du Plessis, SIX, Faf shifting gears against Boult. Rocks back in the crease and pumps the short of a length delivery over wide long-on for half-a-dozen more. Second maximum of the over
Boult to Kohli, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler from round the wicket, Kohli eases it to long-on for one
Boult to du Plessis, 1 run, short and slow on middle and leg, du Plessis hooks it over square leg for one
Boult to du Plessis, SIX, du Plessis breaks the shackles. Latches on to this short ball and nails the pull over deep mid-wicket as the ball just clears the boundary. 76m maximum!
Boult to du Plessis, no run, short of a length on off, round the wicket angle as du Plessis punches it to the fielder at cover
Trent Boult [2.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack
Chahal to Kohli, no run, quicker through the air and Kohli steers it to backward point with soft hands

Chahal to du Plessis, 1 run, tad short on off as du Plessis punches it to mid-off for a single. du Plessis clearly struggling against the spinners. A dip in the run rate with spinners in action from both ends
Chahal to Kohli, 1 run, close. A tossed up delivery on leg, full in length as Kohli goes for a slog and gets an inside edge to short fine leg
Chahal to du Plessis, 1 run, nicely tossed up delivery on off, full in length as du Plessis drives it past the spinner, a single at long-off
Chahal to du Plessis, no run, 94.5kph, skids along the deck, du Plessis struggling to middle it. Goes for a punch, mistimes it back to Yuzi
Chahal to Kohli, 1 run, this was on the shorter side, Kohli punches it through the off-side for a single
Yuzvendra Chahal, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack

Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli wanted two, but Faf sends him back. He had nudged it with soft hands through mid-wicket, but the fielder from the deep was quick to gather the ball and get rid of it. Another wily over by Ashwin, keeping the run rate in check
Ashwin to du Plessis, 1 run, 99.6kph, quicker through the air on leg, clipped through backward square leg for one
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler on off, Kohli drives it to long-off along the carpet for one
Ashwin to du Plessis, 1 run, on the pads as du Plessis works it through square leg for a single
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, eased to mid-on by Kohli for a single this time around
Ashwin to Kohli, wide, slingy action by Ashwin as he tries something unusual, but doesn't execute it. Fires a wide down the leg-side

Most runs in the Powerplay in IPL 2024 121 - Virat Kohli (SR: 140.69) 105 - David Warner (SR: 161.53) 101 - Travis Head (SR: 210.41) 101 - Sunil Narine (SR: 224.44) 91 - Abhishek Sharma (SR: 245.94) 91 - Rachin Ravindra (SR: 168.51)

STAT: This is the first time RCB haven't lost a wicket within the powerplay this season. They had lost nine wickets combined in this phase across their first four matches. \n \nRR had taken nine wickets in the Powerplay across their first three matches.
Ashwin to du Plessis, 1 run, flatter through the air on middle and leg, du Plessis knocks it down the ground to long-on for one

Highlights (1-6 overs) - Not much swing for Boult in the first over - Burger starts with a wayward wide outside off-stump - 13 runs off Burger's first over - Kohli smashes the first six of the night, another 13-run from Burger - Ashwin comes on and bowls a tight over - Faf and Kohli give RCB a solid start with a 50+ stand

Timeout! RCB off to a solid start but this is where they have struggled this season. Can the openers continue to keep the scoreboard ticking or will the RR bowlers bounce back with a wicket or two? We shall find out soon..
Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, RCB - 53/0 after 6 overs.. Avesh Khan goes short as du Plessis pulls it over mid-wicket for a single
Avesh Khan to Kohli, 1 run, Avesh Khan goes short and quick as Kohli plays a forehand smash towards mid-on. A direct-hit scored by Hetmyer at the bowler's end but Kohli was comfortably in
Avesh Khan to Kohli, no run, 117.6kph, Kohli grunts in frustration having missed out on a chance to put that away. Was on the shorter side and Kohli pulls it straight to the fielder at mid-wicket
Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, short of a length around off, du Plessis punches it to wide mid-off for a single
Avesh Khan to Kohli, 1 run, 50-run stand up! On the shorter side as Kohli slaps it towards mid-off and takes a quick run
Avesh Khan to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli greets Avesh Khan with a boundary. He provides some width and Kohli has carved it over the vacant point region
Avesh Khan, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, a tidy start by Ashwin. Just three singles from it. This was on a length around middle and leg, Kohli works it to long-on for one
Ashwin to Kohli, no run, slows it down, on the fuller side as Kohli defends it watchfully to extra cover
Ashwin to Kohli, no run, 99kph, another carrom ball, this was slightly fuller, Kohli steers it to point
Ashwin to Kohli, no run, carrom ball on the shorter side, Kohli knocks it back to Ash
Ashwin to du Plessis, 1 run, that kept low on leg, du Plessis works it to wide long-on for a single
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, pushed through on middle and leg, nudged to wide long-on for a single
Ravichandran Ashwin, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
First signs of spin..

Nandre Burger to du Plessis, FOUR, RCB off to another fine start. They have gotten off to such starts earlier in the tournament, but haven't managed to kick on from this point though. This was pitched up by Nandre Burger, du Plessis stays put and thumps it right over the bowler's head. No need for run for those
Nandre Burger to Kohli, 1 run, comparatively slow, drifting on the pads again though, all Kohli goes is work it wristily through square leg
Nandre Burger to du Plessis, 1 run, pitched up slightly, du Plessis mistimes his drive towards mid-off, that allows him to scamper across
Nandre Burger to Kohli, 1 run, on the shorter side outside off, Kohli slices it to square third man for one
Nandre Burger to Kohli, SIX, first maximum of the evening! Nandre Burger goes short, he goes quick and Kohli pulls it over deep backward square leg for half-a-dozen
Nandre Burger to Kohli, no run, 149.1kph, pitched up by the bowler on off, Kohli drives it to mid-off and sets off for a single, but the timing was too fine
Boult to Kohli, 1 run, short of a length outside off, Kohli attempts a cut, mistimes it towards point for one
Boult to Kohli, no run, now he advances down the wicket and steers the back of a length delivery to point
Boult to Kohli, FOUR, short and quick on middle and leg, Kohli swivels and nails the pull through mid-wicket. All along the turf as the ball races away to the fence
Boult to du Plessis, leg byes, 1 run, doesn't provide any room, sharp and quick on leg, off the pads towards the left-side of gully
Boult to Kohli, 1 run, hits the deck hard, short and quick on leg, Kohli goes for a hook, but fails to middle it, just a single towards short fine leg
A few changes in the field for Kohli, back to deep square leg and fine leg
Boult to du Plessis, 1 run, full and wide outside off, du Plessis drives it towards cover where the fielder gets his hands to it with a dive, parrying it towards the fielder in the deep

Nandre Burger to Kohli, FOUR, exquisite. Kohli special. This was fired on the pads and Kohli stays put and flicks it stylishly over square leg. In fact a little towards the left of square leg, not for the first time has he nailed this shot, won't be the last time either
Nandre Burger to Kohli, no run, 145kph, short of a length on leg, Kohli tries to nudge it away, it clips his pads and rolls towards short fine leg
Nandre Burger to Kohli, FOUR, short and punished. Kohli fans in the stands love it. Uses his wrists well and whips it uppishly over wide mid-on for his first boundary of the match
Nandre Burger to Kohli, no run, 142kph, hits the deck hard, on the shorter side as the ball thuds into Kohli's thigh pad
Nandre Burger to Kohli, no run, full and quick on leg, Kohli tries to whip it away through the on-side, gets hit on the pads
Nandre Burger to Kohli, no run, pitched up by the bowler on off, Kohli drives it watchfully to mid-off
Nandre Burger to Kohli, 5 wides, that's a wayward start by Nandre Burger. Fires a wild delivery way outside off, almost towards the slip fielder who fails to stop it and those are five wides..
Nandre Burger, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, width on offer and du Plessis throws the kitchen sink at it. Thumps it over the infield at cover for four runs. Boult goes wicketless in the first over
Boult to du Plessis, no run, 133kph, back of a length around off, du Plessis knocks it into the off-side
Boult to du Plessis, no run, on a length around off, shaping into the batter, du Plessis taps it into the off-side
Boult to Kohli, 1 run, 129.9kph, on the batter's pads as Kohli clips it to fine leg for a single
Boult to Kohli, wide, loose delivery down the leg-side, Kohli misses out on his glance
Boult to du Plessis, 1 run, another short of a length delivery by Boult, du Plessis works it towards the on-side with soft hands for a single
Boult to Kohli, 1 run, starts off with a short of a length delivery on middle and leg, clipped through square leg by Kohli for a single
Kohli and du Plessis are at the crease. Kohli is on strike. Boult will open the attack
